fi.tamk.cgeng.objects

Class GameObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.tamk.cgeng.objects.Sprite
      • fi.tamk.cgeng.objects.GameObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PhysicObject

    public abstract class GameObject
extends Sprite
    GameObject is object that has additional useful features compared to Sprite. Easy access to different listeneres, possibility to check collisions between GameObjects and rectangles usage: Override move method, that is being called by default in update

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameObject(int x, int y, int width, int height)
      Constructor that initializes x, y, width and height of GameObject
      GameObject(int x, int y, int width, int height, java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
      Constructor that initializes x, y, width, height and texture of GameObject.
      GameObject(int x, int y, int width, int height, java.awt.image.BufferedImage image, TileMap map)
      Constructor that initializes x, y, width, height and texture aswell as TileMap and automatic collision detection between object and TileMap.
      GameObject(int x, int y, int width, int height, TileMap map)
      Constructor that initializes x, y, width, height and texture aswell as TileMap and automatic collision detection between object and TileMap.

      void moveX(int speed)
      Used to move player in x -axis, checks for collisions if CollisionSystem is present, use negative number to move left, positive number to right

      Used to move player in y -axis, checks for collisions if CollisionSystem is present, use negative number to move up, positive number to down
